headline.main: SIKORSKI IN CAIRO; WEIGHS POLES' ROLE; Leader Says Transport Is Only Bar to Eastern Action

lead_paragraph: CAIRO, Egypt, Nov. 12 -- If transport difficulties can be solved, Free Poland soon will have an army of 150,000 in action on the Eastern Front, equipped with material from the United States and Britain, General Wladyslaw Sikorski, the Polish commander, said here today.
abstract: Polish Premier Sikorski on Poles role in aiding USSR
snippet: CAIRO, Egypt, Nov. 12 -- If transport difficulties can be solved, Free Poland soon will have an army of 150,000 in action on the Eastern Front, equipped with material from the United States and Britain, General Wladyslaw Sikorski, the Polish comma...

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES
